data.name: A.M. Wood
data.description: Bright American Pale Ale aged on Spanish Cedar.  This beer has a Citrus Hop profile that finishes clean and dry thanks to the good wood.

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Pale to Amber Beer
style.description: Any classic style or unique experimental beer that has been aged for a period of time in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood. This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and/or other unique wood character but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Primary character of the beer style may or may not be apparent. Sour wood-aged beer of any color is outlined in other categories. Fruited or spiced beer that is wood and barrel aged would also be appropriately entered in this category. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character.  The brewer should explain the special nature of the beer to allow for accurate judging. Comments could include: type of wood used (new or old, oak or other wood type), type of barrel used (new, port/ whiskey/ wine/ sherry/ other), base beer style or achieved character. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during judging.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

breweries.name: Quaff Bros
breweries.description: Quaff Bros. is the gypsy beer label owned and operated by the Party Source in Bellevue, Ky. It allows local breweries to showcase their talent through barrel aging projects.

data.name: Barrel Aged Blue-Eyed Belgian Blonde
data.description: We couldn't wait to get some wine barrels, and when you taste this beer, you'll know why. The delicate nature of our Blue-Eyed Belgian Blonde was enhanced by a three-month sojourn in Archery Summit Pinot Noir barrels, infusing it with notes of grape must, subtle cherry, and wisps of oak. Our regular blonde smiles at you - this beer is winking.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

data.name: Barrel Aged Farmhouse Pale Ale
data.description: Our flagship farmhouse ale fermented in stainless steel and aged in oak barrels.

breweries.name: Oxbow Brewing Company
breweries.description:
OXBOW is an American Farmhouse Brewery, specializing in traditional Belgian farmhouse beers with contemporary American influence. 

We brew small batches of beer in a renovated barn on an 18 acre property in Newcastle, Maine.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Growler fill on Friday afternoons from 2pm to 6pm

breweries.name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
breweries.description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

breweries.name: Back Forty Beer Company
breweries.description:
Back Forty is a micro brewery based out of Gadsden, Alabama. With 2 offerings currently distributed throughout the state, Back Forty is the only Alabama based brewery that can be found anywhere from Muscle Shoals to Mobile.

The name Back Forty Beer Company is basically a reference to the back 40 acres of the farm. Tradionally the "Back 40" of a farm is the most challenging to maintain, but also produces some of the best yields due to the rich content of the earth. Likewise, Alabama was one of the last States in The Union to update it's outdated beer laws (MS is the only one left), and now it's time to reap those yields.

The craft beer market in Alabama has a lot of room to grow, and we plan on doing everything we can to make that happen. Our main goal is to focus on the local community and support other small business owners while offering up our tasty flavors for the people of Alabama. 

The company is founded in Alabama, and just about every aspect of this business is supported by Alabama based suppliers. We've worked with a Design firm out of Athens, AL on our label and logos, our attorney is in Birmingham, our accountant is in Dothan, AL, our shirts are printed in Huntsville and our Brewmaster is out of Montgomery, AL. 

We've been working with Jamie Ray (A nationally recognized Brewmaster who has won several medals at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver, CO), for over a year on our first offering, "Naked Pig Pale Ale". And we have several ideas in the works for additional year round offerings in the coming months. We're looking forward to producing some great beers that Alabamian's have never tasted before. Once things get up and running, we'll start releasing some seasonal offerings, one-time offerings, limited edition batches, etc. That's what we're really excited about.

The only aspect of this operation that isn't planted firmly in Alabama soil, is the production and packaging. We had to go to another craft brewery in a neighboring state for our first production batches. This is partially due to the enormous start-up costs associated with building a complete brewery operation from scratch. But it's also given us the opportunity to support another regional micro-brewery while we get up and running.

data.name: Bourbon Badger
data.description: An ale fermented with honey and aged in oak bourbon barrels. Our barrels are all recently emptied of bourbon and only used once to age the Badger. Teased to perfection, you’re sure to like this one.

breweries.name: Man Cave Brewing Company
breweries.description: Three friends turned a renovated pole building in Syracuse, Indiana, into a guys retreat. A perfect hangout to relieve the daily stress with no work, no worries, and of course no women!

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Elektron
data.description: Elektron Amber Rye aged for 4 months in Woodford Reserve bourbon barrels.

breweries.name: Columbus Brewing Company
breweries.description: Columbus Brewing Company is located in the capital city's historic Brewery District. The Columbus Brewing Company was originally founded in 1830. In 1988, the name was once again chosen to resurrect the proud brewing heritage of its namesake. It's our goal to produce unique world class beers. So, we use only the finest ingredients, many locally harvested, to bring you the best in hand-crafted brews. Look for our award winning beers at your local grocery store and be sure to try our other seasonal selections on draft at fine restaurants and pubs throughout Ohio.

breweries.name: River Dog Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Head Brewer John Federal, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.
When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel-Aged Aztec
data.description: This is the award-winning, oak-aged version of our Aztec ale. After toughing it out for four months in Jim Beam whiskey barrels, this beer champions notes of vanilla, coconut, chocolate, and red fruit.

breweries.name: Breakside Brewery
breweries.description: Breakside Brewery is the invention of Scott Lawrence and Tony Petraglia. Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

locations.name: Main Brewery

Sun - Thu: 11:00 am – 11:00 pm
Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

data.name: Bourbon Street Honey Pale Ale
data.description: This is Honey Pale Ale and it is brewed with Louisiana honey and aged in Bourbon barrels

breweries.name: Abita Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans.

In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100-seat brew pub) and moved up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand.


We brew over 160,000 barrels of beer and 10,000 barrels of root beer in our state-of-the-art brewing facility. Our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews.

We are privately owned and operated by local shareholders, many who have been with us since day one.

Abita uses only the finest ingredients – British and North American malted barley, German and American yeast strains, Pacific Northwest hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs.

In Abita Springs, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way.

Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes.

data.name: Brush Fire
data.description: A BARREL AGED Bourbon Cabernet Amber Ale. A dark amber ale aged in Meranda-Nixon Winery barrels and Old Pogue Distillery/Indian Spring Winery barrels, blended to create Brush Fire.

breweries.name: Old Firehouse Brewery
breweries.description:
The dream all began a few years ago while microbrewery hopping in Asheville, North Carolina. The Wife and I were sitting at dinner enjoying some fabulous craft beer and when she made the ultimate statement to me: "You know, for as much as you love craft beer, you should make it for a living."

Thus the mission of the Old Firehouse Brewery was found:  To passionately brew fresh, hand-crafted beer by using only the finest ingredients possible.

Our motto is great beer, great friends and great fun.

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Pale to Amber Beer
style.description: Any classic style or unique experimental beer that has been aged for a period of time in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood. This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and/or other unique wood character but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Primary character of the beer style may or may not be apparent. Sour wood-aged beer of any color is outlined in other categories. Fruited or spiced beer that is wood and barrel aged would also be appropriately entered in this category. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character.  The brewer should explain the special nature of the beer to allow for accurate judging. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during judging.

breweries.name: Jessup Farm Barrel House
breweries.description:
Jessup Farm Barrel House is founded on having fun and letting our creativity explore the myriad of possibilities blending beer has to offer. By blending beers with different fermentation variations we are able to create unique and original flavors. Our goal is to take the robust characteristics from the barrels, and blend to bring out the complexities and delicacy of the flavors.

The Barrel House has a 16-tap selection of various blends. Beer is served in pints, flights and growlers. Growlers are filled with a counter pressure growler filler, to ensure proper carbonation and extend the longevity of the beer.

data.name: Fully Tilted Baltimore Pale Ale
data.description: Full Tilt Brewing's 2014 FULLY TILTED BALTIMORE PALE ALE is the first iteration of our specialty line of brews to reach your lips. This is an unapologetic, uncompromising, and balls-to-the-wall twist on the already hop forward flagship. Irresistibly oaked with a beefed up hop and grain bill; this headstrong IPA won't be quickly forgotten and should not be overlooked. Proceed with caution, and, as always, enjoy.

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Pale to Amber Beer

breweries.name: Full Tilt Brewing
breweries.description:
In this time of exploding craft brewing around the country you really need to step up your game to stand out in the crowd. No shortcuts. No easy way outs. When we brew, we brew with the best ingredients, the best equipment, and complete devotion to making the best beer we possibly can.

We believe in the exploration and advancement of all things craft brew. We refuse to cut corners and are always looking for new ways to improve on our products. We strive to be the best and until we are we will never stop attempting to blow your minds!

data.name: Gold Jacket Bourbon Barrel Cream Ale
data.nameDisplay: Gold Jacket Bourbon Barrel Cream Ale

breweries.name: Canton Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Canton Brewing Company’s Speakeasy tap room is open for business and features a great lineup of beers all brewed right here in our very own brewery. When you visit the Speakeasy you’ll be tasting the traditions of Canton’s premier brewer, dating all the way back to the 1880s. Many of our beers are based on the historical styles for which we were originally known. But we also know you love the new traditions being created in craft brewing so we have plenty of those too. You’ll enjoy tasting amidst the very brewing equipment we use everyday! The restaurant is now open for dinner only for now. We're open T-Th 4 pm - 10 pm and Fri-Sat from 4 pm - 11 pm. The kitchen closes one hour early, but pizzas only will be served until closing. We will post our menu soon.

breweries.name: River Dog Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Head Brewer John Federal, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.
When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

data.name: Looping Owl
data.description: Our Northern Hawk Owl Amber Ale laid down in Grand Traverse Distillery whiskey barrels. Expect major notes of oak, vanilla, and of course Bourbon.

breweries.name: Right Brain Brewery
breweries.description: Hailed as One of the "Top 5 Local Breweries In The Nation", Right Brain Brewery is known for our culinary inspired beers using only whole ingredients, like Asparagus, Cherry Pies, or smoked Mangalitsa Pig Heads. When we're not busy fending off pirates on the Boardman Lake we like to throw art shows, concerts, and even yoga classes in our brewery. Some people love us, some people hate us, and others just don't understand, but we just want to teach you how to Keep Beer Curious.

beerVariation.name: Mermaids Red Ale
beerVariation.description: A well balanced, medium-to full bodied beer, red in color and very flavorful. The red color and slight caramel-roasted flavor comes from generous amounts of caramel malts and a touch of chocolate malts. Well hopped to balance the malty sweetness, and dry-hopped with cascade for a full hop flavor and aroma.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

breweries.name: Creature Comforts Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Creature Comforts was founded by people passionate for starting a craft brewery in Athens, GA, a town that we love and that has the potential to be a craft beer hub and destination for the South East.  The first piece of the puzzle was David Stein who at the time was the head brewer at Twain's Billiards & Tap, a well-known brewpub in Decatur, GA.   David was a home brewer turned pro, whose passion for craft beer had moved him through working at some of the top craft beer establishments.  David was using the name Creature Comforts for his personal home brews and that name became the foundation for the brewery we run today.  David quickly brought on his friend Adam Beauchamp, who was in his seventh year of brewing beer at Sweetwater Brewing Company in Atlanta, GA, a brewery he began working at after leaving a PHD in Genetics program at Emory.  Adam himself was an accomplished home-brewer and he had a wealth of experience running a production brewery.                   

With the help of a craft beer enthusiast and local Athens, GA businessman, Derek Imes, we began building Creature Comforts in a beautiful 13,000 square foot historic warehouse building in downtown Athens.  The building was originally built in the 1940's as a Chevy dealership and later became Snow Tire Co., before Creature Comforts took over.  Building in a 1940's warehouse presented a lot of challenges as well as many wonderful opportunities.  One such opportunity was the chance to salvage and reclaim the old wood from the building that was subsequently refinished and then put back into the brewery in the form of bar tops, tables, wall paneling, and ceilings.  The final result, is a brewery that has won an award for outstanding rehabilitation by the Athens Heritage Foundation and something that we are extremely proud to share with the world.

Approximately two months before opening, we found the final missing piece.  We knew we wanted to bring someone into the family who would handle the business aspects of the brewery, considering the fact that Adam and David are brewers dedicated to spending every minute of their day making the best possible beer.  Through a long journey that ended with a very serendipitous introduction that came via a person in Vancouver, British Columbia, Chris Herron, a Georgia native himself who was living in Connecticut, became the CEO of Creature Comforts.  Chris had spent 12 years working in sales, pricing, and finance for major beverage alcohol suppliers, and was intent on starting a craft brewery in Georgia, which made him joining Creature Comforts an easy choice.   We have since added, Blake Tyers a veteran and forward thinking home brewer as a brewer at Creature Comforts, and we brought on Katie Beauchamp to manage our office activities, tours and special events.  Combined with the nearly 20 part time tour staff we have, our entire family is together and we have  20+ years of experience.

What started out as curious exploration of what we love, turned into us uncovering our passion, following that passion, and finding happiness, which has allowed us to enjoy the Creature Comforts of life.   Creature Comforts Brewing Company is truly our very own creature comfort.  Our brewery is what makes us happy, it is what makes us feel at home, it is what comforts us, and puts us in a happy place.  Creature Comforts is the end result of the story of our past and the starting point for the story our future, and we look forward to writing that story with you.

data.name: Pernicious
data.description: We start with out flagship Pisgah Pale the age it in oak barrels for a wicked long time, allowing a special strain of wild yeast convert residual sugars into an amazing subtle sourness. Champagne-like effervescence carries the aroma of pressed grapes as flavors yield to a bright hoppy finish. Enjoy!

data.name: Punishment
data.description:
Q: "What do you call it when you take a sip of oak barrel aged Double Bastard Ale that's had the other half of the bounty of chili peppers from Greg's home garden ceremoniously added in, resulting in a punishingly intense level of hot pepper heat to an already overly intense beer whose elevated alcohol level caused a significant transference of pain-inducing 
capsicum?" 

A: "Punishment."

breweries.name: Stone Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

data.name: Red Wine Barrel Aged Belgian Strong Golden
data.nameDisplay: Red Wine Barrel Aged Belgian Strong Golden

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Pale to Amber Beer
style.description: Any classic style or unique experimental beer that has been aged for a period of time in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood. This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and/or other unique wood character but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Primary character of the beer style may or may not be apparent. Sour wood-aged beer of any color is outlined in other categories. Fruited or spiced beer that is wood and barrel aged would also be appropriately entered in this category. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character.  The brewer should explain the special nature of the beer to allow for accurate judging. Comments could include: type of wood used (new or old, oak or other wood type), type of barrel used (new, port/ whiskey/ wine/ sherry/ other), base beer style or achieved character. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during judging.

breweries.name: Canton Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Canton Brewing Company’s Speakeasy tap room is open for business and features a great lineup of beers all brewed right here in our very own brewery. When you visit the Speakeasy you’ll be tasting the traditions of Canton’s premier brewer, dating all the way back to the 1880s. Many of our beers are based on the historical styles for which we were originally known. But we also know you love the new traditions being created in craft brewing so we have plenty of those too. You’ll enjoy tasting amidst the very brewing equipment we use everyday! The restaurant is now open for dinner only for now. We're open T-Th 4 pm - 10 pm and Fri-Sat from 4 pm - 11 pm. The kitchen closes one hour early, but pizzas only will be served until closing. We will post our menu soon.

data.name: Smokestack Series (2013)
data.description:
Bourbon Barrel Quad
16% Ale, 84% Ale aged in bourbon barrels with cherries.

breweries.name: Boulevard Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to Boulevard Brewing Company, the Midwest's home for fine ales and lagers since 1989. Boulevard's mission is simple: to produce fresh, flavorful beers using the finest traditional ingredients and the best of both old and new brewing techniques.

breweries.name: The Black Abbey Brewing Company
breweries.description: “St. Anne, help me! I will become a monk!” Thus cried Martin Luther as a summer thunderstorm bore down on him in Stotternheim, Germany in 1505. These words marked the beginning of a momentous shift in religious history, but as you’re about to see, they led to some great beer, too.

breweries.name: Jessup Farm Barrel House
breweries.description:
Jessup Farm Barrel House is founded on having fun and letting our creativity explore the myriad of possibilities blending beer has to offer. By blending beers with different fermentation variations we are able to create unique and original flavors. Our goal is to take the robust characteristics from the barrels, and blend to bring out the complexities and delicacy of the flavors.

The Barrel House has a 16-tap selection of various blends. Beer is served in pints, flights and growlers. Growlers are filled with a counter pressure growler filler, to ensure proper carbonation and extend the longevity of the beer.

data.name: Welder’s Wood
data.description: A wood-aged treatment of Tradesman’s year-round Welder’s Agave Wheat, made with Mezcal Agave!
